location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. File notes appear at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file reports the death of Salim An Nadir [Salīm al-Nādir?], on 4 October 1947, wrongly identified in the Bahrain Intelligence Report, dated 28 October 1947, as the Saudi Arabian Trade Agent. He was in fact the unofficial buyer of supplies for the Saudi Government. Correspondents include: the Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bahrain, and Gordon Noel Jackson, Political Agent at Bahrain. It is noted in the file notes that 'Neither HMG nor the Sk [Sheikh] of Bahrain have officially recognised a Saudi Trade Agent at Bahrain' (f 5).
